From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To define a character that causes a packet to be sent for the current session, use the **terminal dispatch-character** command in EXEC mode.

ParaDef.Info: The ASCII decimal representation of the character, such as Return (ASCII character 13) for line-at-a-time transmissions.
(Optional) Additional decimal representations of characters. This syntax indicates that you can define any number of characters as dispatch characters.

Examples: The following example defines the characters Ctrl-D (ASCII decimal character 4) and Ctrl-Y (ASCII decimal character 25) as the dispatch characters:
ExtraInfo: At times, you might want to queue up a string of characters until they fill a complete packet and then transmit the packet to a remote host. This can make more efficient use of a line, because the access server or router normally dispatches each character as it is entered.

RelatedCmds.description: Defines a character that causes a packet to be sent.
